title: Bondi beach shooting: where exactly the attack happened?
description: 7NEWS Presenter Hugh Whitfeld explains where exactly the tragedy took place in Bondi and why the gunmen chose the bridge for their fatal attack. #bondi #bondibeach #crime #Sydney

title: LIVE updates of the Bondi Beach shooting (viewer discretion advised)
description: Two gunmen, identified as father and son, have killed 15 people at Bondi Beach in a horrific Sunday night terror attack that has sent shockwaves through the nation.  Gunfire was reported to police just after 6.40pm on Sunday, sending hundreds fleeing from the beach as officers raced to the scene.  This is a developing story. title: SA Jewish community shaken after Bondi massacre | 7NEWS
description: The Bondi massacre has left South Australia's Jewish community shaken and fearful for their safety. Extra police were immediately deployed to Hanukkah celebrations in Adelaide when news of the attack broke, with synagogues abandoned under safety advice from Jewish leaders. The Premier and opposition leaders have paid their respects at the Adelaide Holocaust Museum while authorities continue monitoring intelligence about potential links to South Australia. title: Queensland Jewish community grieves Bondi victims | 7NEWS
description: Queensland's Jewish community is grieving following the Bondi synagogue attack, with extra security measures implemented at synagogues across the state. Hanukkah events have been cancelled on the Gold Coast while memorial services are being planned, and landmarks including the Story Bridge will glow white in solidarity. Community leaders are calling for support and checking on Jewish neighbours during this difficult time. title: SA students celebrate SACE results online | 7NEWS
description: South Australian Year 12 students received their SACE results with over 17,000 logging in to view their scores after the annual awards ceremony was cancelled due to the Bondi attack. Students like Sienna Uzanovich achieved high scores including 98.05, while graduates now await January to learn if they've secured places in their preferred university courses. title: Queensland hospital bed promise faces delays | 7NEWS
description: The Queensland government has revealed a timeline for delivering 2,421 hospital beds by 2032, with fewer than 900 beds expected to be ready by the 2028 election deadline. The plan includes bed allocations across multiple cities including Townsville, Bundaberg, Hervey Bay, Toowoomba, Ipswich, and Brisbane hospitals. The state's mid-year budget update shows an increased operating deficit partly due to $345 million in public sector pay deals, while coal and petrol royalty revenue is expected to be $500 million lower than predicted. title: Port Arthur massacre advocate calls for stronger gun laws after Bondi attack
description: The Bondi Beach terror attack, Australia's deadliest since Port Arthur, has reopened old wounds for many Australians. 7NEWS spoke to Stephen Bendle, director of the Alannah & Madeline Foundation, named in memory of the two daughters killed at Port Arthur, about the lasting trauma and urgent need for stronger gun laws. #bondi #bondibeach #crime #law #Sydney

title: New updates following the Bondi shooting massacre | 7NEWS
description: A terror attack at Bondi Beach has claimed 15 lives, with gunmen opening fire on innocent people during Sunday afternoon activities including Hanukkah celebrations. The attack was carried out by a father and son who had travelled to the Philippines and were found with an ISIS flag in their vehicle. Floral tributes and vigils are growing at Bondi Beach as the community mourns victims including 10-year-old Matilda, rabbis, a Holocaust survivor, and other members of the public. title: Hollywood director's son charged with parents' murder | 7NEWS
description: Nick Reiner, 32-year-old son of Hollywood director Rob Reiner, has been arrested and charged with the double murder of his parents Rob and Michelle Reiner, who were found stabbed to death at their Los Angeles home. The younger Reiner, who has a documented history of drug problems and homelessness, is being held on $4 million bail. Rob Reiner was known for directing films including When Harry Met Sally, The Princess Bride, A Few Good Men, and Misery, and was politically active in Democratic causes. title: Incredible first hand account and footage of Bondi shooting | 7NEWS
description: An experienced international camera operator provides a firsthand account of the Bondi shooting incident, describing gunshots, police under fire, and violent confrontations on a bridge. The witness recounts seeing officers pinned down by gunfire and observing the arrest of suspects in what he describes as a chaotic and dangerous situation. The incident has left the local community shaken and questioning whether Bondi will recover from this traumatic event.
